author: wsjcom
title: The FBI’s FISA Abuses Need to be Exposed
text:
As your Feb. 1 editorial points out, when it comes to “An Unaccountable FBI,” we have seen this movie before. Few Americans remember how FBI Director J. Edgar Hoover abused his power and used dirt on people for political leverage. He even intimidated presidents. That FBI abuse was why Congress changed the law in 1973 and put a 10-year term limit on the director of the FBI. It is also why Congress has been given the oversight duty to make sure that the FBI doesn’t abuse its power and operates with political neutrality based entirely on the rule of law.
